title: TOCTOU race on volatile currentGameId in SkeletonCallbackHandler
description:
SkeletonCallbackHandler.java has a volatile UUID field `currentGameId` (line 87) with 4 compound check-then-use patterns:

- Line 188: `UUID myPlayerId = currentGameId != null ? activeGames.get(currentGameId) : null;`
- Line 449: same pattern
- Line 1086: same pattern
- Line 1493: same pattern

Between the null check and the `activeGames.get()` call, another thread could set `currentGameId` to null, causing a NullPointerException or returning the wrong player ID.

Fix: snapshot `currentGameId` into a local variable before each compound operation, same pattern as the lastChoices fix.
